wiki.content: “Indica Badu” is an anthem explaining the beauty of smoking weed, featuring Wiz Khalifa, who’s known to be an avid smoker of marijuana. Relating to the vibe smoking weed gives off, the vibe of the instrumental is very chill and resembles how someone would feel on a high. The song also ends in exactly 4:20, a number used to represent weed and smoking. The title “Indica Badu” derives from the combination of Cannabis Indica aka marijuana and Erykah Badu, an American singer-songwriter, record producer, disc jockey, activist, and actress and is recognized as being one of the most legendary female artists of all time. This combination assists in the theme of the song that weed is amazing. One reason that this song is very chill and resembles how someone would feel on a high is because it uses the drum pattern as “Metropolis,” which was sampled from “Use Me” by Bill Withers. The same sample is also used on Kendrick Lamar’s “Sing About Me, I’m Dying of Thirst.” This song seems to have been in the works for a while, as Wiz first teased the collab back in December of 2017. Read more on Last.fm. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License; additional terms may apply.
